FIGREF4.text: Y 3 and Y * 3 by fixing a vertex, getting 12 − 30 + 20 for Y 3 and 20 − 30 + 12 for the dual Y * 3 , as we know already. The real novelty is the appearance of the pentagons, both in 3d and in 4d. In Schläfli notation, we have {3, 3, 3} for T 4 , {4, 3, 3} and dual {3, 3, 4} for H 4 and H * 4 .; {3, 3, 5} for the 600 cell Y 4 , and dual {5, 3, 3} for the 120-cell, Y * 4 .

FIGREF5.text: Coxeter-Schläfli notation, the 24-cell is clearly {3, 4, 3}. It only remains to compute the isometry groups: one sees "easily" that one should include three new rotations, for the triangular surfaces of the octahedron: |Isom(24 − cell)| = 3 · |Isom(H 4 )| = 1152 which coincides, as it should, with the Weyl Group of the second exceptional Lie Group F 4 (private communication from Joseph C. Varily).

FIGREF6.text: 7 i=0 x i e i ; define the conjugateō as in C or H: changing the signs but of first term. Then for o = 0 the normōo = N (o) is real = 0, so define the inverse as o −1 = o/N (o), and one has the (nonassociative, noncommutative) division algebra of the octonions!
